intro: Restio sulcatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Restio sulcatus is adapted to Mediterranean climates and is known for its resilience to drought and salt spray.
